author: ankur2534
content: 1559 will also make it a lot easier for users to avoid overpaying - e.g. paying 200 gwei when the min gwei is down to 100 gwei. But I don't think 1559 will be included in Berlin

author: ajsutton
content: 1559 is definitely not in Berlin. The EIPs to include in Berlin are already set and fork blocks chosen for testnets. The next fork will be London which should be around July (time is relatively fixed because of the need to push back the ice age).

author: ajsutton
content: You’re right about 1559 making it easier to set fee levels but to be clear it won’t reduce the fees paid which, even when accurately set to the minimum required, are very high due to demand for block space.

author: ankur2534
content: Yes eip-1559 won't change min gas price which will remain very high. But it would solve the situation where, e.g. Binance ETH withdrawals all occur at 250gwei+ even when safe-low gas price dips to 100ish

author: ankur2534
content: Which still counts as an effective reduction in user fees IMO

author: huntingisland
content: What is the current status of the merge?

author: huntingisland
content: We just had a cabinet official of the current US administration paint an environmental target on Bitcoin

author: huntingisland
content: I've heard Vitalik etc. discuss "emergency deployment of the merge"

author: huntingisland
content: I think we are getting very close to that scenario

author: sky.cactus
content: Emergency deployment is only likely to happen in response to an attack on the network, such as a 51% mining attack.

author: huntingisland
content: I think legislation on an executive order banning proof-of-work in major polities such as the United States also constitutes an attack on the network, and anything we can do to avoid that, we should do
